info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 4:54PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central El Paso County through 530 PM MDT... At 454 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Security-Widefield, or 8 miles southeast of Colorado Springs, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and up to half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Colorado Springs, Fountain, Manitou Springs, Ellicott, Stratmoor, Schriever AFB, Security, Peterson AFB, Security-Widefield, Cimarron Hills and Fort Carson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
